I have really come to like posts that have typos in them. I find myself stopping across content that look imperfect at first glance but often contain useful information, in contrast to other posts that look very well organized with bullet points and carefully separated paragraphs. Why?
AI. And I am so tired of it!
You take one look at the format and boom, you know that was AI generated. Notice how I wrote "that was" and not "that it was" in the previous line? I might be grammatically incorrect, but my folks know what my choice of words are when I am having a conversation. Thats what make me, me.
Which brings me to the point. Folks will argue that theres no harm in using AI productively, and honestly I use AI myself from time to time when I am in a tough spot. Some of my earlier LinkedIn posts were done with the help of AI albeit still somewhat edited and changed to suit my approach more.
But being completely reliant on AI? Generating every single post, every single email, every single Teams or Viber group comment? I draw the line when it is impossible to match the written material with the author.
If you work in a professional capacity, I KNOW that you have seen examples of the following scenario at your workplace. Sending an official mail written in AI, only to have the recipient copy the content of the first mail and paste it in ChatGPT with the keywords "Generate a professional reply with the following points" and then copy the AI generated response back into the Reply All thread. Where's the effort!
Folks in social media using an AI generated image of themselves, with an AI generated caption using vocabulary that they themselves dont know the meaning of. Who are these people!
I am getting severe AI fatigue at this point, and strongly feel like it is taking away our identity and replacing it with its own. We are losing our ability to THINK! Its easier to have AI draft a mail, or think of a clever name for an event than actually rack our brains to see if its possible for us to come up with it ourselves. And that bothers me.
So here's a request to the good people in my network. I propose we limit the use of AI in our lives. Write your own emails, generate your own posts. Make it lame, make it grammatically incorrect and riddled with spelling errors. But make it original. To HR personnel I will recommend adding a "Written Test" to your hiring pipeline where you provide them with a pen and paper to physically write an answer to a question.
Because its embarrassing to meet the author of a post/mail only to see that they cannot form two structured sentences together when conversing verbally.
